newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: MAZEIKIU NAFTA URGES IMPORT DUTIES ON OIL.
newsitem.headline: MAZEIKIU NAFTA URGES IMPORT DUTIES ON OIL.

text.p: Lithuania's oil refinery Mazeikiu Nafta has urged the Economy Ministry to impose customs duties on all imported oil products, except heating oil, the daily Lietuvos Rytas reported on Thursday.
Mazeikiu Nafta suggested imposing customs duties of 10 to 20 percent on oil products imported from the countries Lithuania has no free trade agreements with until the year 2000, the newspaper said.
Mazeikiu Nafta controls 35 percent of the country's fuel market and would like to expand its share to 80 to 90 percent, the newspaper added.

The paper quoted Economy Minister Vincas Babilius as saying that measures would be implemented which would force leading international oil firms operating in Lithuania to purchase their products from Mazeikiu.
Mazeikiu Nafta wanted to impose higher exise duties on imported petroleum last summer, but the request went unanswered, the newspaper said.
The company sold 42 percent of its products in Lithuania last year.
